story.storykicker: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie have put divorce rumours to rest as they have reportedly bought a GBP 2.65 million mansion in Majorca, Spain.
story.storybody:
Last few months, rumours have been doing the rounds of social media that all is not well in Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt's paradise.

ALSO READ: Here's why Angelina Jolie has asked Brad Pitt to go for DNA test 

ALSO READ: Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie on the verge of divorce? Is Cara Delevingne the reason behind their split?

Several reports suggested that Angelina's declining health is due to her failing marriage. Some websites also attributed Angelina's weight loss to Brad Pitt is growing closeness to his Allied co-star Marion Cotillard.   

Putting all these rumours to Hollywood power-couple has bought a new mansion in Majorca, an ancient town of Andratx, Spain.

According to Bang Showbiz report, Jolie-Pitt bought a GBP 2.65 million mansion in Majorca after falling in love with the island.

Brad Pitt, who is filming his World War II drama Allied, in the town approached a real-estate tycoon Alessandro Proto to help him find a property.

Alessandro Proto told newspaper Diario de Mallorca, "Brad Pitt fell in love with the Balearic Islands after shooting his new film in the Canaries and that's why he asked us to find him a house in Majorca."

Brangelina's new villa is stated to have eight bedrooms, a large garden and a swimming pool.

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie's new investment has definitely put rumours to the rest. In March, a report published in InTouch magazine, Angelina Jolie has become "pale, gaunt, and exhausted" as her health "has only gotten worse as her relationship with (Pitt) deteriorates."

These reports surfaced first when Jolie was spotted in London with her children. Her 'skeletal appearance' made headlines that the couple is on verge of divorce.

Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie are parents to six kids, out of which three are adopted: Maddox, 14, Pax, 12, Zahara, 11 and three biological Shiloh, 9, and twins Knox and Vivienne, 7. The couple has recently relocated to London where Brad is filming Allied.

Directed by Robert Zemeckis, the upcoming film is based on a true story. The film also stars Marion Cotillard (Marianne Beausejour), Jared Harris (Lincoln) and Matthew Goode (Downton Abbey).

Allied is scheduled to release on November 23, this year.
